title: ScarBrace Yourselves
review: With an extremely star-studded cast, Brian DePalma, a director who isn't unfamiliar to films associated with organised crime, crafts a magical feature in which Al Pacino really thrives in the role of Antonio 'Tony' Montana. With a very hard-hitting plot and an immaculate supporting team, this film can't go wrong. However, this film doesn't hit the bar of perfect due to it's excessive, overexaggerated violence.

title: Mission OverImpossible
review: Ethan Hunt returns to the phenomenal Mission Impossible franchise in its second outing, Mission: Impossible II. With an interesting romantic plot and improved Special Effects, this film can't be missed, especially if you're a fan of the first. However, many action sequences are overexaggerated, even if they're meant to be 'impossible'.

title: The Unfortunate Escape
review: With an immensely powerful cast, this classic war-story is filled with laughs, emotion and digging. A simple story about an actual event which is action-packed, this film is truly remarkable, and one of the best war pictures of the last century. However, at times, the story is all over the place, making it slightly unfulfilling.
